radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is diffusely echogenic with a smooth contour. There is a focal heterogeneously hypoechoic lesion in the right lobe measuring 1.5 x 1.6 x 1.4 cm which may represent focal fatty sparing. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. No ascites. The CHD measures 6 mm. The gallbladder is nondistended and contains small stones at the fundus with no pericholecystic fluid. The pancreas appears within normal limits without masses or pancreatic ductal dilation.
